symptoms.name: Watery diarrhea
symptoms.severity: Variable, can be mild to severe

symptoms.name: Bloody diarrhea
symptoms.severity: Variable, can be mild to severe
symptoms.pattern: Acute onset, often present in severe cases

symptoms.name: Mucoid diarrhea
symptoms.severity: Variable, can be mild to severe
symptoms.pattern: Acute onset, often present in severe cases

symptoms.name: Fever
symptoms.severity: Variable, can be mild to high

symptoms.name: Stomach cramps
symptoms.severity: Variable, can be mild to severe

symptoms.name: Seizures
symptoms.severity: Occasional complication, more common in young children

symptoms.name: Hemolytic-uremic syndrome (HUS)
symptoms.severity: Postinfectious manifestation, associated with Shiga toxin-producing strains

symptoms.name: Bacteremia
symptoms.severity: Occasional complication, more common in children under 5 and adults over 65 with underlying disease

vital_signs.heart_rate: May be elevated in severe cases
vital_signs.blood_pressure: May be decreased in severe dehydration

physical_findings: Diffusely erythematous mucosa with numerous small ulcers (proctoscopy)
risk_factors: International travel (especially to areas of high endemicity)
Men who have sex with men (MSM)

required: Positive stool culture for Shigella dysenteriae
supportive: Clinical symptoms (fever, diarrhea, stomach cramps, tenesmus)
Presence of fecal leukocytes on stool smear
